data.event: In 1811, a post office was established on what is now S.C. Highway 290.

In 1854, the town changed its name to Vernonville or Vernonsville in honor of local physician J.J. Vernon. In the mid-1850s, plans were under way to put a railroad line through Duncan, but the impending Civil War disrupted them.
It wasn’t until 1873 that the Atlanta and Richmond Railroad laid a line through the town.
In 1881, the name change became official.
